result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 101803,
Payable Number: 1040997,
Receipt Number: 22RP042841,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Shamara Gonzalez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court in person for Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel confirms appointment to case and requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by William Rakestraw.

Defendant Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with J.L.C and N.A. R
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Harry Oscar-Edward Ramos in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
